Function.Description: The sin function computes the sine of its argument.

Brief.Overview: The sin function computes the sine of its argument .
Brief.Overview-Complex: The sin function returns the sine of complex number where the argument is expressed in radians (pi radians equals 180 degrees).
Brief.Usage: The sin function is used to compute the sine of a value.
Brief.Usage-Complex: The sin function is used to determine the sine of angle when the angle is complex. Do not use if an immediate type, such as a real number, would suffice. Since complex numbers are heap objects, they require more space and operations on these types are slower than on immediate types.

Syntax.Return: Computes and returns the sin of the Number argument.

Syntax-Complex.Return: A complex number holding the sine of the angle.
